com.reliablerabbit.ejg
Class Sound

java.lang.Object
  com.reliablerabbit.ejg.Sound

public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object

Play 3D sounds in your game simply and easily.

Author:
Mohammad El-Abid

Method Detail

setListenerPosition

public static void setListenerPosition(float x,
                                       float y)
Move the 3D "microphone" of where the user is/hears sound relative to.

See Also:
setListenerPosition(float, float, float)

setListenerPosition

public static void setListenerPosition(float x,
                                       float y,
                                       float z)
Move the 3D "microphone" of where the user is/hears sound relative to.

Parameters:
x - Any x value, be consistent in how you generate x values here for your play(x, y)
y - Any y value, be consistent in how you generate y values here for your play(x, y)
z - Any z value, this mainly plays a role in the volume of your sounds.

setZCordSounds

public static void setZCordSounds(float newZ)
Set the Z coordinate for sounds that are played.

Parameters:
newZ - New Z coordinate.

play

public static void play(java.lang.String source,
                        float x,
                        float y)
Play a one-off sound, do not loop.

See Also:
play(String, float, float, boolean)

play

public static void play(java.lang.String source,
                        float x,
                        float y,
                        boolean loop)
Play a sound object without instantiating an object. Useful for bullets or other sounds that may overlap or do not need to be persisted in RAM.

Parameters:
source - Resource path of sound file.
x - X coordinate, relative to the listener position.
y - Y coordinate, relative to the listener position.
loop - True if the value should be looped.

play

public void play(float x,
                 float y)
Play the sound at the x and y coordinates specified.

Parameters:
x - X coordinate, relative to the listener position.
y - Y coordinate, relative to the listener position.

stop

public void stop()
Stop the sound, if it is currently playing.

releaseAll

public static void releaseAll()
Release all current sounds. Will cause problems for pre-existing sounds, but is a way to flush all current sounds.

release

public void release()
Remove the sound from RAM, this should be done before deleting a Sound object. Otherwise the sound will continue to exist in the sound system.

isPlaying

public boolean isPlaying()
Check if the current sound is playing.

load

public static void load()
Setup the sound system, may take a few seconds. It is automatically loaded when you create a sound object, but it may be preferable to load it while the application is starting.

setupSoundSystem

private static void setupSoundSystem()
